text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale, on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen, I'm so excited to

finally share with you, my recipe or sort
of my take on a Jerk Chicken.

I'm also going to serve it - because I always
do - with some coconut rice with peas, which
I'll share with you later.

This recipe has been really highly requested,
and if you came to my meet and greet at my

book launch party in New York, then you know
that I really wanted to put this recipe in

my cookbook but I didn't because the spices
were just so different than what was already
in the book.

And everyone was like, you have to share it
anyway on Laura in the Kitchen!

So, I'm sharing it with you but please, the
first thing you need to know, of course, is

that this is not by any means authentic, I've
never been to Jamaica, the Caribbean, anything

like that, but if you do have an authentic
version, I would absolutely love for you to

share it down below because I think it's always
nice for not only me, but for everyone else

to kind of read what your food is like, you
know, where you're from in the world.

So, this is my take on the chicken and I'll
show you the rice later.

You will need some chicken, I prefer drumsticks,
to me, bone-in skin-on drumsticks is what
I like to go for.

Now for spices, for my marinade, I've got
ground allspice, ground cinnamon, dried thyme,

nutmeg, brown sugar, salt, black pepper, then
I've got some fresh onion, fresh garlic, this

is a habanero pepper, soy sauce - grated ginger
- a little light olive oil, or vegetable oil,
and some lime, fresh lime juice.

Now, I know there are a million different
recipes for jerk chicken so keep in mind this

is just my version and also I know that traditionally
it's made on a big grill, but I can't get

those same charred flavors, so roasting it,
I get that same deep caramelized flavor but
without grilling it.

But you can grill it if you want to but you
just have to keep an eye out that you're not
burning it.
Okay, let's work on the marinade.

Now I'm going to show you how I like to chop
up my habanero because I don't like to touch

it if I don't have to, at least not while
I'm cutting it, so what I do, is I'm going

to take it like so and use tongs, sort of
like as a hand, and I just cut around the
side like so.

If a few seeds go in there, that's fine but
I don't want all the seeds to go in there,

so I just like to take sort of a small knife
and cut around it like so.

And I try to never touch it because you know
that habaneros are very, very spicy and if

you touch it and then touch your eye or something
it can be really brutal so, see!
Never touched the habanero.

So now pretty much all of my spices, my garlic
goes in, my onion, this is just a yellow onion,

that goes in, you could even use scallions
if you want to but Iprefer the regular onion.

I've got my soy, it is such a combination
of stuff, isn't it?

Of flavors, but I promise they just work together
so well and give you such a nice spicy chicken.

But it's not like so spicy, even though there's
a habanero in there, it's weird how it works
when it's roasting in the oven.

You need about two tablespoons of a light
olive oil or vegetable oil.
Then I've got my spices, get them all in there.

And this is going to make your house smell
so fantastic.

And then about three tablespoons of fresh
lime juice, I take about one small lime, it
does the trick for me.
Get that all in there.

You need to invest in one of these things,
I know I use it backwards, but I just feel

like it works so much better, I don't know
why but it does so just trust me on this.

Squeeze it all in here, and now all I'm going
to do is I'm going to puree this and just

so you know - come on get on here - there
we go.

I'm going to puree this and I'm also going
to place my chicken into a plastic resealable

bag because I'm going to pour the marinade
right on top so I'm going to do that and I'll
show you what it looks like when it's there.
That looks fantastic!

You can see it's mostly, you know, pureed,
but if a few chunks are in there, it's fine.

Try to get it all out, sort of try to maneuver
the bag so that it's all going in there.

You can, by the way, use different portions
of chicken if you want to use thighs, bone-in

skin-on and breast, bone-in skin-on, you can
do whatever you want, I just happen to love
my drumsticks so that's what I tend to use.

Squeezing it all out, and then you just need
to give it a really good massage.
Like so!

Now, this really is best if you do it the
night before and you let it marinate all night,
all day or whatever.

I"m going to leave it for probably about 4
hours or so and then I'm going to cook it

because the longer it sits the better, the
more of that flavor of the marinade permeates

through the chicken, so I am just going to
let this hang out in the fridge for about

4 hours or so and then I'm going to roast
it, I'll show you what it looks like once

the marinating part has been done and then
we'll get going on the rice too which is just

an amazing accompaniment to the spicy chicken,
it's sweet and sticky, it's fabulous!

Alright, my chicken has been in the fridge
for several hours, I've got my oven pre-heated

to 400 F, what I have here is a roasting pan,
not dirty, it's just really old, and this

is one of my most treasured baking pans that
I own because I feel like I've cooked so many
things in it it's got history of it's own.

Okay, all you need to do is just get my chicken
and my marinade out, just like that, get a

pair of clean tongs, and you just move things
around like so.

And this ll kind of like, you know if a little
bit of the sauce scorches around the edges

and stuff, it's fine because you can just
clean it right off.

Alright, just make sure that every piece is
just well coated and of course you want to

do skin side up for this, so that the skin
gets nice and crispy, but you see how I like
to move it around and just juj it in the sauce?

Excellent, alright, this just needs about
45 minutes at 400 degrees and I like to put

mine on the very top rack, I like to move
my rack to the very top of the oven so that

the very top gets nice and scorched, so I'm
going to go put this in and then we'll get
going on our sticky coconut rice.

Alright, for the rice, you'll need some long
grain white rice, these are some pigeon peas,

they come in a can, if you can't find these,
red kidney beans work just as well, you need

water and some full-fat coconut milk and a
pinch of salt.
That is it!

Everything goes into a pan at one time which
is so lovely, now my chicken does need 45

minutes and this does need only about 25,
but the longer it sits the more sticky it

gets, which I really love, so if you like
fluffy rice, I would wait until you're closer

to eating time ,but I like it really sticky
so that's how I take mine, you put everything

in, and then my rice takes about 25 minutes
to cook fully, so what I like to do, is I

like to bring this mixture to a boil, let
it simmer on medium-low, covered for about

twenty minutes, then I turn the heat off and
I just let it sit for another twenty minutes

and it gets perfectly sticky, the rice still
has a little bit of texture to it it comes

out perfect every single time, and if you
see that it looks like the coconut milk is

sort of splitting on top, do not panic because
once this starts cooking and you keep giving

it a stir, it somehow just combines with the
rice and it just comes out perfect every time,

so I'm going to let that go but like I said,
bring it up to a boil on medium heat, bring

the heat down to medium-low, put a lid on,
twenty minutes then you turn it off completely,

and you let it sit there until the chicken
is fully cooked, and I'll show you what it

looks like when this is done, and the chicken
is done and we can finish it off and get to
eating.

My chicken was in the oven for 45 minutes,
you can see it's got really lovely darn and

golden brown, if you want to, if you feel
like it's not getting crispy enough for you

after 45 minutes, you can always pop it under
the broiler for a few minutes and it will

crisp it up right away, to me it doesn't make
a difference, because as you can see my oven

gets it really nice and dark, but it's up
to you.

My rice is also ready, now like I said, this
is very sort of sticky, it's not fluffy rice

so this is how I personally like it so, what
I like to do - I've already been snacking

on it - I could lie to you but I'm not going
to!

What I like to do is I like to take my rice,
I like to put this on my serving platter because,
of course I like to serve them together.

This is so good, this rice is so good and
you don't only have to make it for this particular

recipe, I just love it really with anything,
it's really good and it would go really well

with my jerk shrimp tacos, it would go really
well with that with my mango salsa, it would

be delicious but today I'm going to show you
how I like to serve it with my chicken because

to me, they just compliment each other, and
then I just take my chicken and I kind of
just nestle that all around my rice.

I have another piece of chicken in here, I'm
not going to add it to my plate because otherwise

it would mess up my beautiful sort of array
of chicken to rice here, I actually made this

last weekend and I posted a picture on Instagram
in the same dish and everything so I knew
that I had to share it with you guys.

I like to finish it off with some green onions,
and that is it!

It's all in one pan and I serve it just like
this, everything is together, it's just flavor
wise, it's gorgeous!

The chicken, I'm actually not going to just
serve that because I've got another piece

in here, the chicken is so juicy, it's so
juicy yet so flavorful and I love it so much!

Needs a little bit of rice though, and even
though it's quite, it is spicy, it's not going

to knock you back and you can't eat it, it
just somehow goes well with that allspice,
and the nutmeg and the cinnamon.

And then, you have the sweet sticky coconut
rice to kind of balance it all, it is by far

one of my very very favorite things to eat
in the entire world and when I make this,

I want to shake myself for not making it often
enough because it's really really fantastic,

and everyone always loves it I always get
rave reviews, and I hope that you guys enjoy

it too, go to LauraintheKitchen.com to get
the written recipe, I hope that you enjoy

my version of a Jerk Chicken with Coconut
Rice, I would love to hear from you if you

re-create this dish, share it with me on Instagram,
Twitter, here in the comments.

Hope you've enjoyed spending time with me
and I'll see you next time!
Bye!
